text: appearance:  dark reddish brown; near white head.  aroma: 	smells awesome, with caramel, vanilla, and bourbon prominent.  taste: 	as the aroma indicates, with some rye spice and resinous hops.  finish: 	slightly spicy, with that bit of pine to clean things up; lighter palate than expected, but not prohibitively so. notes: Creative. Enjoyable.  Draft at Owens Ordinary, Rockville, Maryland.

Sample @ CBC Boston, 2016. Hazy reddish pour with a small head. Nose is interesting  cherry fruit leather and some gentle toffee. A touch of marzipan and vanilla. Similar flavor with coconut-like accents. Toasted coconut, red fruits. Caramel. All over the place, here, but its engaging stuff.

Draft @ Taproom, Malmö. Pours a dark amber ruby color with a small long-lasting off-white head. Has a fruity malty spicy caramel bourbon aroma. Fruity malty spicy bourbon caramel flavor. Has a fruity malty spicy bourbon caramel finish.
looks like burnt tree bark. not super sweet. has a milkiness to it. creamed corn and caramel and vanilla. odd description I know. low carb

Keg at Ma Kellys, 14/11/16.
Orange golden with a decent off white cap.
Nose is orange pith, light pine, melon, caramel, straw, toasted brioche.
Taste comprises airy malts, orange rinds, caramel, light Tropicana, passionfruit, hint floral, fruit loaf.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Decent enough offering ... drinks well below the ABV.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Draft at CBC - pours brownish - nose/taste of rye, coconut, cherry, sherry and malt - medium body

Keg at Mother Kellys - London. Pours deep reddish brown with a creamy, off-white head. Ripe old fruits in the nite, leathery berries, vanilla, toffee. Medium to big sweet flavour with creamy toffee, more ripe berries, currants, chewy dates and vanilla. Medium to full bodied with average carbonation. Sweet and a little sticky in the finish, with more hearty ripe berries, fruitcake, creamy toffee and vanilla, brown bread, light woody notes. Fun stuff.

Keg at Mother Kellys. It pours cloud brown with a medium beige head. The aroma is bitter - sweet, juicy raisin, fruit cake, caramel, toffee, vanilla, toasted nut and bounty bar. The taste is bitter - sweet, toffee, brown bread, fruit cake, resin, pine, earth, chewy malt, vanilla, spice and some boozy alcohol with a dry finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Decent brown ale.
Keg at Cafe Beermoth, Manchester. Hazy red colour. Patchy head. Notes of cherry bakewell, raisins, cocoa. Nice dark chocolate and bourbon heft to the taste. Good stuff.

Keg at mother Kellys. A clouded reddy nut brown coloured pour with a lasting creamy light tan head. Aroma is freshly cut wood, big oaky vanilla, nutty toasted malts, little fruit cake. Flavour is composed of medium sweet layered malts, cakey, toffee, toasted malts, pine and vanilla. Palate is rounded, medium sweet, highish epherical carbonation, dry finish with a little woody tannin.

On tap at What?s Brewing Beer Festival 2016, Stavanger. Pours hazy dark amber with dense off-white head. Aroma of coconuts, chocolate, dark bread. Tastes slightly sweet but still well balanced. Medium bodied.
Spritzig malziger Beginn, erhöhte Karbonisierung, Vanille und Laktose. Herb würzig, steigende Intensität. Rund, gut. 10/11/10/11//11

Keg at Well and Bucket, Shoreditch, Saturday 8th October 2016   Pours hazy dark brown with a filmy light beige head. Vanilla, a bit of cheap aftershave, bourbon and some other stuff on the nose. I havent got a clue what style this. Creamy with vanilla and a bit of a spice edge, boozy, nice mouthfeel. Its ok but not a big fan. A6 A3 T6 P3 Ov12 3.0
On tap at CBC. Poured a deep amber color with an off white head. Some bourbon, vanilla, cinnamon, woody, and some chocolate.

UPDATED: SEP 21, 2016 Draft at Bru Craft. Hazy dark brown/black pour with off-white foam. Splashes of lace. Heady brandied brew; feels above the listed 8% ABV. Glossy dark malts. Chocolate liquorice sugar candies. Thin sweet coffee. Black currants. Red wine barrels. Plum pudding. Charred coconut. Peat. Some nail polish in the nose. Stronger and more interesting than I was expecting.
Keg at salthorse. Pours deep brown, nose is caramel, sweet toffee, wood, taste is sweet, chewy toffee, wood, vanilla, coconut.

Keg @ Salt Horse, Edinburgh (Rainbow Day 2016). Pours brown/redish, murky with a small off white head. Nose is red wine, slight booze, fruity and a touch smokey. Taste is very much like a red wine, slight wood/oak, slightly sweet and a fruity finish with right at the end a chocolate touch.

Tap. Leeds International Beer Festival. Murky brown. Thin, lasting, beige head. Nose has tangy fruit. Dusty malts. Some toffee. A bit woody and vinous. Taste is sweet, initially, turning light dry and woody bitter. Oily palate. Woody, fruity, light bitter finish.
Keg at Tilt Brum; hazy brown pour with a creamy tan head, aroma has toasted coconut and some red fruits, taste has immediate coconut, red cherry, quite bake well with some sweet action.
A special relationship indeed, rye,bourbon Cinnamon with an overriding taste of Cherry makes this a lovely unique beer

Keg @ Tilt, Brum. Pours deep brown, good off-white head. Aroma is earthy spice, bourbon. Taste is smooth nutty bourbon, chocolate, layered malts and earthy dark fruits. Quite a flavoursome little chap.
Keg at salty horse... Dark red brown... Small tan head... Soft sweet toffee chocolate.. Dark fruit.. Light spice nose... Dark roast malts.. Rich dark fruit malts

Brown beer, Aroma is almost wine-y, rich and fruity, with a healthy whiff of liquorice as well. Flavour has a hit of the liquorice too, with a lot of malt and spicy fruit. Although it feels and tastes almost like a wine or something it doesnt taste its strength. Rich, tasty and very, very nice.
